title: TV best bets: Wed., Oct. 14
text:
TV best bets: Wed., Oct. 14 October 14, 2015 Last updated: Wednesday, October 14, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
8 p.m., CW/CHANNEL 11: Arrow — Jeri Ryan guest stars as a mayoral hopeful whose bid for office worries her longtime friends Oliver and Thea (Stephen Amell and Willa Holland) in the new episode "The Candidate." 
8 p.m., NBC: The Mysteries of Laura — How loyal does one stay to the past? It's a valid question for Laura (Debra Messing) and her colleagues in the new episode "The Mystery of the Convict Mentor," since their pursuit of fugitives sentenced for murder is complicated. One of those on the run happens to be the detectives' former captain, sparking suspicion they might not be giving the case their all. 
9 p.m., ABC FAMILY: Baring It All: Inside New York Fashion Week — This new two-hour documentary gives viewers a behind-the-scenes look into one of the world's biggest style-related events of the year. The focus is on both veteran and rising industry insiders who are changing the fashion landscape. 
9 p.m., CBS: Criminal Minds — Series star Joe Mantegna doubles as director again with the new episode " 'Til Death Do Us Part," which sends the team to Savannah to probe the serial killings of brides-to-be just before they were to wed. 
10 p.m., FX: American Horror Story: Hotel — In the new episode "Chutes and Ladders," fashion mogul Will Drake (Cheyenne Jackson, "30 Rock") arrives, bringing a sense of couture to the Hotel Cortez. Elsewhere, a model catches the eye of the Countess (Lady Gaga), and John (Wes Bentley) learns about the hotel's sadistic founder and first owner, James March (Evan Peters). Kathy Bates also stars.
